news.title: Samsung to hold its Galaxy S26 event on February 25
news.summary: Samsung is going to launch S26 lineup just before Mobile World Congress (MWC).

news.title: With co-founders leaving and an IPO looming, Elon Musk turns talk to the moon
news.summary: According to The New York Times, which reports that it heard the meeting, Musk told employees that xAI needs a lunar manufacturing facility, a factory on the moon that will build AI satellites and fling them into space via a giant catapult.

news.title: OpenAI policy exec who opposed chatbot’s “adult mode” reportedly fired on discrimination claim
news.summary: The executive has denied the allegation that she engaged in discrimination.

news.title: Okay, now exactly half of xAI’s founding team has left the company
news.summary: Whatever the cause of the departures, the cumulative impact is alarming. There is a lot of work left to do at xAI, and an IPO will bring more scrutiny than the lab has ever faced before.

news.title: Amazon may launch a marketplace where media sites can sell their content to AI companies
news.summary: A new report claims the e-commerce giant is looking to create a pipeline of licensable content between media publishers and AI companies.

news.title: T-Mobile will live translate regular phone calls without an app

news.title: Uber Eats adds AI assistant to help with grocery shopping
news.summary: Uber announced a new AI feature called "Cart Assistant" for grocery shopping in its Uber Eats app. The new feature works a couple different ways. news.title: ‘Shut up and focus on the mission’: Tech workers are frustrated by their companies’ silence about ICE
news.summary: Keep your head down. Compartmentalize. Don't make trouble. That's what many tech workers are taking their CEOs' strategic silence to mean, amid an immigration crackdown across the US by the Trump administration's Department of Homeland Security. news.title: The Toyota Highlander is now a three-row electric SUV with 320 miles of range

news.title: Amazon Ring’s Super Bowl ad sparks backlash amid fears of mass surveillance
news.summary: Ring's new Search Party feature has once again drawn backlash for the company.
